question: According to a recent Oxfam report, what is the rank of India in Health Spending Index?
explanation:
According to Oxfam, an international confederation of charitable organisations India is ranked at 155 in Health Spending Index.
The survey data revealed that India spent only 4 per cent of its budget on health. India is also ranked at 129 out of 158 countries in the Commitment to Reducing Inequality (CRI) Index. India is also one among the worldâ€™s worst-performing countries in tackling inequality amidst the pandemic.
